title: Bed Bath & Beyond Decluttered Its Stores and Ended Up Frustrating Shoppers
sub_head: Home-goods chainâ€™s inventory overhaul during Covid-19 pandemic led to a shortage of products and reduced sales
body:
Early in the Covid-19 pandemic, Bed Bath & Beyond Inc. wanted to improve the shopping experience by reducing the number of products in stores and launching new, private-label brands.
Those moves, led by Chief Executive Officer Mark Tritton, ended up making the home-goods chain vulnerable to supply-chain problems that have roiled many retailers, according to former employees, industry executives and analysts.
